1.title: Big Dreams
1.plot: College design graduate Andrew Kanakis, who chose the subject just to meet girls but proved talented, is one of six apprentices hires to help out in preparation for the annual New York Fashion Week. The quick learner enjoys being assigned with Rachel Jacoby to represent eccentric Jane Magazine after being hazed in a fake initiation 'nude shoot'.

2.title: Where's Nicole?
2.plot: Andrew really impresses the editorial brainstorming meeting with his idea and is assigned to execute it, entering a frat again undercover to report on cocky practices, but only his or his colleague's article will be published. The lipstick apprentices must organize an event and learn to deal with different attitudes. Nicole compromises her job by not turning up nor properly communicating about her diagnosed stress-problem, even admits to her dad she lacks commitment.

3.title: It Isn't Always Glamorous!
3.plot: Andrew does a great job researching and writing his frat tricks article. he hosts his colleague in his cool apartment. Nicole is back but wines, blames everyone else and ends up resigning on her own account after miserably fucking up an evaluation on her own.

4.title: Pick Me!
4.plot: Andrew's next assignment allows him to meet a famous designer, whom he gets on with so well she even invites him to present some of his own designs. He also hosts a barbecue for all 20 assistants. The only spoilsport is house-mate Bridget, whose immature attitude still doesn't spoil his friendly flirting, while others openly wonder or express jealousy. Nicole's successor is selected trough auditions, Rachel rebuked for spying.

5.title: Thank God You're Here!
5.plot: Based on essays, co-boss Matt chooses as apprentice-personal assistant Laurie, the girl which initially made the least favorable impression, but she seems to first in quickly. Andrew is now totally at ease, except about his murky 'non-'relationship with Bridget, who is just as uneasily confused and unable to tackle the issue. Then Andrew is messaged that according to its own website, Jane, the magazine where he works, is going bust.

6.title: The Party's Over!
6.plot: Unlike his wining ex-colleague, Andrew considers Jane's bankruptcy an opportunity to pass on, with valuable experience and network, to another career phase. He dares take a loan and recruit his friends as most willing models to start designing gowns. He also offers Bridget a 'home-cooked' dinner, but she still can't make up her mind, so he leaves her disappointed.

7.title: Playing with the Boys
7.plot: Despite his doubts whether to remain an assistant, Andrew does and passes an interview, so he's recruited by teen magazine CosmoGirl on account of his 'outsider' male perspective. His first job, assisting at a 'pink' photo-shoot, is a turnoff, mainly steaming clothes. Privately, he arranges a double date for his visiting mate, an accountant, with Laurie. The girls enjoy assisting at a sexy shirtless studs in the stable photo-shoot.

8.title: Who's Hooking Up in the Hamptons?
8.plot: The weekend before Fashion Week, the six assistants get a chance to attend 'Super Saturday' in the Hamptons while residing in a cool holiday home. Andrew remains his charming, amusing, helpful self, although dealing with five girls and some implicit hostility is really too much. The treats include a stretch party bus, surfing lessons and lots of food, never mind the calories.

9.title: It's Go Time!
9.plot: Fashion week has started, so the assistants are flat-out. Andrew can only afford to finish two dresses to present to a designer he's fan of, so he gets an evasive, yet rather encouraging response. Bridget suddenly announces she's moving out of his apartment to save on rent. The girls eagerly accept to dine with Janjay's friend Bobby and a model mate of his, but when only that hunk Angel turns up and tells Bobby is late and actually dates cheerfully, Janjay rudely walks out, even when he arrives last-second and dumps him.

10.title: Surviving the Catwalk
10.plot: The New York Fashion Week ends as quickly as it started hectically. The six assistants try to boosts each-other's confidence before their assessments, which determine who gets a long-term job. Some however opt out openly or implicitly by their unenthusiastic attitude. Andrew isn't offered a magazine post, supposedly because he tends to struggle with deadlines, but already believed his actual future is in design anyhow.

locations: New York City, New York, USA
imdb.title: The Fashionista Diaries
plot: A look at the lives of assistants working in the fashion industry as they prepare for designer Charlotte Ronson's fashion show during New York's Fall Fashion Week.::IMDb editor
